annotation.spannedText: Mumps can be prevented with vaccination

classMention.mentionClass: Mumps can be prevented with vaccination

annotation.spannedText: Children should receive two doses of MMR vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: Children should receive two doses of MMR vaccine

annotation.spannedText: MMR vaccine is very safe and effective

classMention.mentionClass: MMR vaccine is very safe and effective

annotation.spannedText: MMR vaccine is the best way to protect children against mumps and to prevent them from spreading the disease to others

classMention.mentionClass: MMR vaccine is the best way to protect children against mumps and to prevent them from spreading the disease to others

annotation.spannedText: They should get at least one dose of the MMR vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: They should get at least one dose of the MMR vaccine

annotation.spannedText: If you do not have written documentation of mumps immunity, you should get MMR vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: If you do not have written documentation of mumps immunity, you should get MMR vaccine

annotation.spannedText: There is no harm in getting another dose of MMR vaccine if you may already be immune to mumps

classMention.mentionClass: There is no harm in getting another dose of MMR vaccine if you may already be immune to mumps

annotation.spannedText: Women who are planning to become pregnant should make sure they are protected against mumps before they get pregnant

classMention.mentionClass: Women who are planning to become pregnant should make sure they are protected against mumps before they get pregnant

annotation.spannedText: Most women of childbearing age were vaccinated as children with the MMR vaccine, but they should confirm this with their doctor

classMention.mentionClass: Most women of childbearing age were vaccinated as children with the MMR vaccine, but they should confirm this with their doctor

annotation.spannedText: If they need to get vaccinated for mumps, they should avoid becoming pregnant until one month (28 days) after receiving the MMR vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: If they need to get vaccinated for mumps, they should avoid becoming pregnant until one month (28 days) after receiving the MMR vaccine

annotation.spannedText: Pregnant women who are not protected against mumps should wait until after they have given birth to get MMR vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: Pregnant women who are not protected against mumps should wait until after they have given birth to get MMR vaccine

annotation.spannedText: Because most people have now been vaccinated, mumps has become a rare disease in the United States

classMention.mentionClass: Because most people have now been vaccinated, mumps has become a rare disease in the United States

annotation.spannedText: high vaccination coverage helps to limit the size, duration, and spread of mumps outbreaks

classMention.mentionClass: high vaccination coverage helps to limit the size, duration, and spread of mumps outbreaks

annotation.spannedText: Before the routine vaccination program was introduced in the United States, mumps was a common illness in infants, children, and young adults

classMention.mentionClass: Before the routine vaccination program was introduced in the United States, mumps was a common illness in infants, children, and young adults

annotation.spannedText: If you are not sure if you are protected against mumps, first try to find your vaccination records or documentation of mumps immunity

classMention.mentionClass: If you are not sure if you are protected against mumps, first try to find your vaccination records or documentation of mumps immunity
